intro: Stephanomeria tenuifolia var. myrioclada, commonly known as the narrowleaf stephanomeria, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
